para.dtcname: Invalid Data Received from Brake System Control Module Invalid Serial Data Received

item.ptxt: The forward recognition camera receives signals from the skid control ECU (brake actuator assembly) corresponding to the brake control status via the CAN communication line.
When a brake control system malfunction signal is received from the skid control ECU (brake actuator assembly), the forward recognition camera outputs U041881.

data-name.name: detect-item
data-name.ptxt: Invalid Data Received from Brake System Control Module Invalid Serial Data Received

data-name.name: dtc-detect-cond
data-name.ptxt: Once 3 seconds elapse after turning the ignition switch to ON, the forward recognition camera receives a brake control system malfunction signal from the skid control ECU (brake actuator assembly) for approximately 1 second or more.

item.ptxt: When replacing the forward recognition camera, always replace it with a new one. If a forward recognition camera which was installed to another vehicle is used, the information stored in the forward recognition camera will not match the information from the vehicle. As a result, a DTC may be stored.

When the forward recognition camera is replaced with a new one, make sure to read Before Starting Adjustment, then perform optical axis alignment for the forward recognition camera and clear the vehicle control history (RoB) for each system.

atten4.ptxt: Forward recognition camera axis alignment can be performed by using either One Time Recognition, Sequential Recognition or Driving Adjustment.
If U041881 is output in the pre-collision system, vehicle stability control system DTCs may also have been output. Check the vehicle stability control system first.

entry.ptxt: Vehicle stability control system DTC are not output
Vehicle stability control system DTC are output

action.actiontitle: GO TO VEHICLE STABILITY CONTROL SYSTEM
